ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He darkened its night and brought forth its morning light.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Gave darkness to its night, and brightness to its day;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and covered its night with darkness and brought forth from it its day;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He has made its nights dark and its days bright.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And He made its night dark, and started its light.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Its night He covers and He brings out its forenoon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And He made dark its night and brought out its light.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and darkened its night, and brought forth its forenoon;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And He made dark the night thereof, and He brought forth the morn thereof.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and making its night dark and bringing forth its morning light,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And He made dark its night, and brought forth its sunshine.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and darkened its night, and brought forth its forenoon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Its night doth He endow with darkness, and its splendour doth He bring out (with light).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Its night He covers with darkness, and its forenoon He brings out (with light).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and darkened its night and brought forth its morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And He dimmed its night, and brought out its daylight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:29] and darkened its night, and brought forth its day: He exposed the light of its sun (‘night’ has been annexed to it [the heaven] because it represents its shade, and likewise the ‘sun’, because it represents its light);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And He made dark the night thereof, and He brought forth the morn thereof) and He made its day and sun clear.
